Headline: Introduction to the R programming language.
Text: I began my career as a data analyst. Thanks in large part to a trainer who demonstrated the exciting capabilities of R. Their presentation sparked my curiosity, and I was eager to learn more so I could do those things myself.

Headline: Story - Designing the most beautiful and optimal Indian road trip
Text: Used R to scrape data for 55 travel destinations from the National Geographic website, geocoded the destinations, and visualized them on a map. Then played with a few algorightms to figure out the shortest route to cover all these destinations. .
Media Caption: Designing the most beautiful and optimal Indian road trip

Headline: Volunteered at DataKind Bangaore (BLR)
Text: At DataKind, we applied our data skills by collaborating with non-profits working on civic issues. Until now, I had primarily worked with clean datasets, but this experience opened my eyes to the multitude of challenges involved in using public data effectively.

Headline: Working with public data at Socialcops
Text: We developed a data collection application for non-profits operating in low or no-internet areas, as well as data-driven tools for government departments to monitor the performance of goverrnment programs.
Media Caption: Powering Ujjwala Yojana, India's Gas Subsidy for 50m Women

Headline: Learning about the Open Data ecosystem at CivicDataLab
Text: Collaborated with the civic tech community in India to build datasets and open data portals in the areas of public finance, law and justice, etc.
Media Caption: Open Data Day

Headline: Story - Analysis of Indian Elections using R.
Text: This collection of data analysis notebooks was created for delivering a course on R. The topics include managing projects, processing datasets using the tidyverse set of packages, visualisations, GIS analysis and reproducible research.
Media Caption: Analysing data from Indian Elections using R

Headline: Story - The Zombie Tracker
Text: We created the Zombie Tracker to monitor cases filed under Section 66A of the Information Technology Act, which was declared unconstitutional by the Supreme Court in 2015. Despite this ruling, Section 66A has been repeatedly misused by authorities as a tool to suppress free speech.

Headline: Story - Know Your High Court Judges (KHOJ)
Text: The KHOJ dataset includes data of more than 1700 judges across 43 indicators. It enables more in-depth research into the composition of the High Courts and judicial behaviour.

Headline: Building public data pipelines at DataforIndia
Text: Data For India uses public data from the Indian government and multilateral agencies like the World Bank to produce research-backed data-driven insights and charts on socio-economic issues.
